The formula works like this (it doesn't really matter what your code
actually does).  Your library/algorithm takes some input and produces
some output.  Your tests should call your library with different input
and then verify (assert) that the output is correct in each case.  You
can do this on the whole library as well as individual methods on
individual classes.
 
Hope this helps; call back if you need more detail (or Google for the
basic examples--they're all over).
..David..

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of

Sent: Thursday, September 01, 2005 9:02 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Testing state cover


Hi. I have implemented an algorithm in Java which produces state
cover, shortest paths to get another statefrom start state, from a
finite state machine(FSM). How can I test whether this has produced
right paths using JUnit test. 

Thanks,
